question: 抱く
sourceAnswer:
<read>いだく</read>:: to{} hold-in-one's-arms-(e.g.-a-baby)/embrace/hug | have-(a-thought-or-feeling)/hold/harbour-(suspicion,-doubt,-etc.)/harbor/bear-(a-grudge,-ill-will,-etc.)/entertain-(hope,-illusions,-etc.)/cherish-(e.g.-an-ambition)
<read>だく</read>:: to{} hold-in-one's-arms-(e.g.-a-baby)/embrace/hug | have-sex-with/make-love-to/sleep-with | sit-on-(eggs)/brood
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>hug</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to hug</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to embrace</vocabulary>. <ja>抱いて抱いて！</ja>
sourceReadingMnemonic: What are you going <vocabulary>to hug</vocabulary>? How about a cute <reading>duck</reading> (<ja>だく</ja>), or even just your <reading>da</reading>d (<ja>だ</ja>). Duck<ja>を抱く</ja>?
